intro: Consolida regalis subsp. paniculata, commonly known as the royal crown flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces elongated, branched inflorescences known as paniculata, which give it its subspecies name. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it prefers well-drained soil in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in gardens with proper care.
